data.title: Settings editor groups show wrong settings in Windows when opening VS Code with settings editor opened
data.body:
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on any folder
2. Open Settings
3. Make sure all settings groups show correct settings
4. Reload VS Code by command `Reload Window`
- Settings now show different settings in groups

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/23220788/53827334-f923-11e6-9dc6-a5f744cbbbd6.png)

data.title: Don't show D&D target cursor for original text selection
data.body:
Testing #21012:

- select some text
- start D&D operation
- move the mouse pointer (which marks the drop target location) over the original text

Observe: the dotted cursor is shown but if you end the D&D operation by releasing the mouse button, nothing happens.

Since the original selected text is not a valid drop target, no dotted cursor should be shown.

data.title: Syntax Highlighting breaks for extremely long line (Go Support)
Typing still allowed while D&D operation under way
data.body:
Testing #21012:

While dragging some text to a target location, I'm still able to type at the original position where the cursor blinks. 

Neither Sublime nor TextMate support this and I find the blinking cursor rather distracting.
I suggest to disable typing while a d&d operation is under way and to hide the blinking cursor.

In addition I find the dotted d&d cursor difficult to spot.

data.title: Wrong syntax colouring for the number 7 in Visual Basic
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Declare a Dim or Const in Visual Basic with the Visual Basic syntax colouring
2. Set it equal to any number that does not start with 7
3. Set it equal to any number starting with 7

With any number starting with the number 7 the syntax colouring stays the variable colouring, rather than changing to the number colouring.

data.title: Column breakpoint should stick to the word on the right
data.body:
Testing #20192

- Have the following JavaScript test program: `x1 = 9; x1= 10;`
- Set the breakpoint before the second x1
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23216938/f182746e-f917-11e6-8f79-76c1fcb4e376.png)
- Set the cursor after the first semicolon and type another statement
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23216981/1318c0f6-f918-11e6-956d-07d37338232e.png)

Breakpoint should stick to the word on the right

data.title: jsdoc completions everywhere?
[GIT] SCM Preview doesn't consider actual encoding in diff view

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file with especific file encoding and change it.
2. Observe encoding diferences in diff view

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/423449/23216601/4c03e1e8-f8f5-11e6-8815-fe80067e81bb.png)

Testing #20999 

There is a setting to enable warning for long commit messages. Even though it is enabled, there is no warning shown for long messages. Also it would be helpful to update the description of the setting about the length of the message

data.title: Column breakpoints under Linux only rarely accepted
data.body:
Testing #20192

My test JavaScript program is
```java
console.log(x); console.log(x + 1); console.log(foo()); console.log(foo() + foo());
x1 = 9; x1= 10;
```

and I try to set column breakpointbetween statements, on the statement, on expressions.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23216293/c4135a54-f915-11e6-859b-2030a02726c6.png)
but when running they are mostly rejected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23216329/dad7448a-f915-11e6-84cb-0566106bd6a1.png)

data.title: Hover doesn't render sub/sup html elements in Markdown text
data.body: Hover doesn't render sub/sup html elements in Markdown text. - VSCode Version: 1.9.1/1.10.0-insider - OS Version: macOS 10.12.3 Steps to Reproduce: 1. hover over some text returning `xx+1. xi+1` 2. Text should be rendered as xx+1. xi+1 This follows up on https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/155, where I'm now trying to make Javadoc return sub/sub HTML tags as-is, in the Markdown text (unreleased WIP): The Markdown rendering engine in VS Code supports it, as can be seen in the Markdown preview pane, just not in hover mode.

data.title: Formatting JS code removes spaces before closing parenthesis
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use settings:
```js
"javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": true,
"javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyParenthesis": true,
```
2.Type:
```js
setTimeout( function() {

} );
```
3. Format it.

**Result:**
Now the result is following and space before curly brace is eaten:
```js
setTimeout( function() {

});
```

**Expected Result:**

No change after formatting.

data.title: Unable to set breakpoints in untitled file with associated path
data.body: Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19415 if you follow Seans steps, you will see that you cannot add breakpoints to untitled files, which imho would be nice in this scenario.

data.title: Linux: folder with .vscode opens even if I pick a file deep in the hierarchy
data.body:
Testing: #20671

OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

* have a folder with a .vscode folder inside that also has node modules
* from the CLI open any file from the node modules folder

=> you end up opening the parent folder that has the .vscode inside
=> reading #20671 I was under the impression that we would only check the parent for having a .vscode folder contained.
=> are we walking up more than one parent to find the .vscode folder?

data.title: Linux: file opens even though it has parent folder with .vscode inside
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20671

- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. from the desktop click on a file to open in Code that has a parent with a .vscode folder (I used the hello world TS extension for this)
2. only this file opens, I would assume the parent folder opens

/cc @Tyriar that might be something here with what arguments we are passing over when launching like this on Linux.

data.title: Not getting any debug commands
data.body:
Testing #20982

Version 1.10.0-insider
Commit 256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65
Date 2017-02-22T07:09:05.746Z

Linux

- In the VSCode workspace, open VSCode on the 'extensions/html' folder.
- press Ctrl + E, type: debug with space at the end
- an empty dialog shows up
- click the dialog away
- error message shows up:
Unable to instantiate quick open handler vs/workbench/parts/debug/browser/debugQuickOpen - QuickOpenHandler: {"errorCode":"load","moduleId":"vs/workbench/parts/debug/browser/debugQuickOpen","neededBy":["===anonymous10==="],"detail":{"errno":-2,"code":"ENOENT","syscall":"open","path":"/usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/browser/debugQuickOpen.js"}}

data.title: Replace with a string that contains search string goes endless when replacing manually
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. vscode sources, search for "copyright"
2. replace with "copyrightttt"
3. click on an individual result to replace

=> the individual result never disappears
